p: Another (–)-borneol derivative with an ester group, namely bornyl (2 Z)-4,4,4-trifluoro-2-[2-(4-methylphenyl)hydrazinylidene]-3-oxobutanoate 132 ( Figure 36), was studied as an inhibitor of the main human isoenzymes involved in the biotransformation of ester-containing drugs: hCES1 and hCES2 [ 10]. The tested ester derivative of natural occurring (–)-borneol with the hydrazinylidene group is more active and selective against hCES1 than against hCES2. This compound inhibits hCES1 with the IC 50 values of 0.098 ± 0.008 μM and has inhibitory activities against hCES2 with an IC 50 value of 2.10 ± 0.18 μM.
